intro: Ferula marathrophylla, commonly known as the mountain fennel, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and its leaves are pinnately compound with a strong, pungent odor. Ferula marathrophylla is adapted to arid and high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of alpine flora.
